body: +1 very good fix. I would like to merge it for the next RC.

Important fix!
+1 to merge and include in the next RC
Merging..

Thanks for the PR. I will try it out.

One general comment though. Can we please not merge several issues into a single PR? The problem is that this breaks the automatic linking of PRs and JIRA issues. In this case, FLINK-2903 will not receive any comments made on this PR. Separate PRs for individual issues is also requested by our [coding guidelines](http://flink.apache.org/contribute-code.html#coding-guidelines).
+1 for @mxm suggestion to use a simple button like the +/- buttons.

Ah. Apologies. Will separate 2903 related work.
On Nov 4, 2015 3:52 PM, "Fabian Hueske" notifications@github.com wrote:

> Thanks for the PR. I will try it out.
> 
> One general comment though. Can we please not merge several issues into a
> single PR? The problem is that this breaks the automatic linking of PRs and
> JIRA issues. In this case, FLINK-2903 will not receive any comments made on
> this PR. Separate PRs for individual issues is also requested by our coding
> guidelines
> http://flink.apache.org/contribute-code.html#coding-guidelines.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1323#issuecomment-153672870.

Fair enough, if that's the majority view. I'll push a commit later today
for this.
On Nov 4, 2015 3:53 PM, "Till Rohrmann" notifications@github.com wrote:

> +1 for @mxm https://github.com/mxm suggestion to use a simple button
> like the +/- buttons.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1319#issuecomment-153672916.
Thanks @sachingoel0101!

The changes look good to me. IMO, both should be added to the next RC.
@sachingoel0101, when do you think you can update the PRs?

Probably in a few minutes. :') 
Just building and making a final test right now.
It's okay to include the task manager legend related work with this, right? That's too minor to open a jira and track separately.
I think it's OK.

Thanks for the update @sachingoel0101.
Good to merge!

You will open a new PR for 2903 soon, right? Thanks
Already done. #1326
Forgot to add the component name in the commit message. I don't wanna trigger a useless build on travis, so whoever commits this should probably make that change before merging.
I'd like to merge this on the master but I don't think it should be included in 0.10 because it is too big of a change for a release candidate. Additionally, it's not a pressing issue.

That's a good point. It might inadvertently break things.
For the release candidate, how about including just the first part, i.e., just the detached mode for standalone clusters. That would not break any functionality, and bring the yarn and standalone mode at par as far as detached mode is concerned. It will definitely stay broken for both in case of eager jobs.
LGTM
Merging this PR
Merging this PR

Here are the new screenshots:
![screenshot 48](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8874261/10936854/2fdbaa34-8315-11e5-91ac-4386193b89e3.png)
![screenshot 49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8874261/10936855/2fe987f8-8315-11e5-8fbf-91f2a6b54a4c.png)
Some minor commenets. Could we remove the "x" from the button? I think it looks odd. While cancelling, could we display just "Cancelling..." without a button?

I updated this PR with the reworked logic, it has several advantages over the previous timestamp based solution (including the elimination of transactions from the logic).

The only problem I see is that the derby batch inserts happen row by row currently as it does not have the insert or update semantics.

This rework will also make it easier to write connectors to non transactional stores like Cassandra
I also removed the sharding logic now as I think it was pretty weak and not very useful (it maintained 1 connection per subtask which would break if we change parallelism)

Here's a screenshot though:
![screenshot 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8874261/10937618/2175022e-831a-11e5-8d4b-7ff5c5257fc5.png)

IMO this should be included in the release.
I want to have a final look today. Is the Scala ok from your side now, @tillrohrmann?
Yeah looks good now :-)
Yes, much better in my opinion.
I've pushed the relevant commit. Should be good to merge. @mxm

Just updated this. Redirect works now for contribution/coding guidelines. About the color scheme: it is not very exciting; however, the purpose was to make it better distinguishable from the Flink project page -- I guess this goal is reached. If nobody has a better ideas, I would like to merge this.
-1 This change breaks the nightly deployment. I'll reopen FLINK-2898. Sorry for reacting so late to this, I was on vacation

We should not just merge it without addressing peoples concerns about the color scheme. IMHO it does not look good like this and there are also issues with the highlighting of the currently selected page. For example, if I click "Overview 1.0" the menu entry is not highlighted, as it is before this change.

Also the mouse-over color is now different from the colors that are used to signify the currently selected page.

Of course I want to address other peoples concerns: "If nobody has a better ideas".
What would be a good color scheme? Please provide some constructive ideas! I will not merge as long as people tell me, they don't like it. But "I don't like it" does not helpful to improve it ;)
If you add it in `AbstractUdfStreamOperator` then you can remove the `setOutputType` in `WindowOperator` and `NonKeyedWindowOperator`.
Good point. Will update the PR.

I would simply change "Overview 1.0" to "Documentation 1.0" in the doc.
Doc:
![screen shot 2015-11-04 at 17 22 06](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68551/10944283/cb88d3d2-8318-11e5-8251-b8e3513be84c.png)
Flink Website:
![screen shot 2015-11-04 at 17 22 12](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/68551/10944351/1278e3f4-8319-11e5-9da0-2cdbfddc886f.png)

To me this makes it clear that I'm in the documentation. I can click the Flink Logo to go back to the Flink homepage.
Good fix. Let's include this for the next RC.
I second Aljoscha. Also, I suggested twice (on the mailing list and in the PR comments) to change "Overview" to "Documentation" which should help a lot to differentiate the pages.
The grey navigation bar is not an acceptable solution to me. Furthermore, I suggested to add a bar on top of the navigation with something like "Documentation 1.0 | Back to Flink homepage".

I don't like the idea of the second navigation bar. The menu should not occupy too much space. And using the logo as back link to the homepage is a very good solution. @aljoscha What is your opinion?

About the color: I player with a view other colors, and all of them were ugly... What color scheme would you like? It was gray before -- so is your concern about gray in general or about the darker color?

Why do you open a pull request against a JIRA issue if you don't plan to address its concerns and ideas? If you don't agree with the JIRA description, please feel free to start a discussion in JIRA before opening a pull request.

-1 from my side for a different color scheme. The colors are well-adjusted and don't need to be changed.

Sorry, I linked the PR to the wrong JIRA issue. 
Will close this PR and open a new one.
I updated the sharding logic to do mod hashing by default on the keys for the number of shards, and the user can also add a custom Partitioner to implement custom sharding strategy.

Hi @ChengXiangLi, sorry for the long reviewing delay.
The PR is definitely moving in the right direction! I added a couple of comments in-line. Please let me know if you have questions or would like to discuss some of the comments.

We will also need a few tests that check the OptimizedPlan that is returned by the optimizer. We have a few tests in place that check for example that correct execution strategies are chosen by the optimizer. Since we manually rewrite the plan, it would be good to have tests that verify our changes, for example for cases where an operator has multiple outputs of which only one or all require range partitioning. Please have a look at `PartitionOperatorTest` and other tests in the `flink-optimizer` module.

Best, Fabian
PR looks good.
PR looks good.

I guess there is some miss understanding. Of course I want to address concerns and ideas. That is the reason why we have this discussion (and I am glad that you participate!). The JIRA itself is not very precise and only states an idea how it could be resolved. This PR is my suggestion how to resolve it. If the community does not like it, that's fine. Up to now, I interpreted your concerns about the changing the color as "you don't like _how_ I changed the colors" -- now it got clear to me, that you don't like to idea of changing color at all. (I miss understood your concerns; sorry for that).

Furthermore, I did start a discussion about this on the mailing list and @uce had the idea about changing the style: https://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/flink-dev/201510.mbox/%3C79C15FB9-EB82-433F-AC1D-2823CEF018AE%40apache.org%3E
Some people seems to like it and I shared a like to a first draft (before I opened this PR). There was not too much feedback about the link, so I proceeded by opening PR.

I take your concerns very seriously but still like the idea about changing the style of the doc page for a clearer distinction from the project web page.

I guess we all agree that changing "Overview" to "Documentation" should be done. But This does not resolve the JIRA IMHO.
Does the cancel button also work for jobs which have been restarted?
A restarted job will get in running state, and that should allow it to be cancelled. Should I allow cancelling in the `RESTARTING` state as well?
No I think that's fine. I was only concerned whether the button is visible after a restart because you remove the button while cancelling...
It should pop up again when the job gets in running state again.

Thanks for clarifying your approach on the issue. I believe that you are taking concerns seriously but I also think that merging when there are clear open concerns is not an option. 

I don't want to dismiss the option of changing the color scheme per se but I don't want to sacrifice readability of the documentation just to make it appear differently from the homepage. So my take on the issue would be to change only very small things like replacing "Overview" with "Documentation" and including a hint for the user that he can go back to the homepage. For design changes, I'd like someone to work on it who knows how to change the style in a nice way.

What about a notice text on the front page of the documentation like "You're viewing the documentation 1.0. To go back to the Flink homepage please click on the squirrel."? That  might already help a lot of people.

I agree that changing the colors is a tricky issues. Does anybody have good design skills? From my point of view, a clear visual difference is the only way to get a clear distinction. All other suggestion are only minor improvements of the current status.

I tried to "play designer" but without success (even if I like it personally and don't thinks I sacrificed readability -- but of course, this is just personal opinion). As I am running out of further ideas, I guess somebody else needs to resolve the JIRA.

If you are ok with it, I will change "Overview" to "Documentation" as well as the redirect thing and merge those changes to close this PR. The JIRA stays open...

One more thing: I also had the idea of adding the "external link" symbol at the main page to the "Quickstart" and "Documentation" menu (either in the menu point or in all link of the menu-list). I did not got any feedback if this would be an improvement or not (I am not sure by myself either). Of course, this does not reflect this PR but is a change in flink-web project.

Hey @s1ck,

thanks a lot for the PR! I left a few minor comments on the docs.
One thing that confuses me is what is the difference between `graph1.intersect(graph2)` and `graph1.intersect(graph2, true)` ?

Hey!
you're welcome :) I will fix the comments later today. There is no difference, `graph1.intersect(graph2)` is just a convenience method if the user wants the default behaviour, which is `graph1.intersect(graph2, true)`.
hmm I see. It's not very nice to have 2 different ways of doing the same thing imo. Could we just keep the second one maybe?
yeah, that's fine with me.

I'm with you that the design could be improved but I rather have some small changes such that we have an improvement over the current situation. So let's merge with "Overview" renamed to "Documentation", redirect from the How-to-contribute page, and adding external link icons to the Documentation and Quickstart menu (good idea!).
+1 to merge

Changing "Overview" to "Documenation" breaks the layout for me (using Firefox). What about using "Home Docu 1.0" instead?

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8959638/10974851/36a3c804-83e4-11e5-9a74-497c42f77a66.png)
I'm not too fond of "Home Docu". Can you reduce the size of the search box? That should do it.
Thanks. Looks good!
Rebased to current master. Should be good to merge.
Thank you @rmetzger. I'll merge :)
Failure on an unrelated test: JobManagerSubmittedJobGraphsRecoveryITCase
Good idea. Just updated this. Please verify that it renders correctly for you. And let me know if I can merge it.
Thank you. Merging.
Thanks for the update. Works for me in Firefox, Chromium, and Safari. Good to merge with an increased timeout for the redirect.
Just updated. Set redirect to 5 seconds (this gives enough time to read the single line). Also added comment that auto redirect is enabled. Please check the "look an feel" of the redirect.
Looks good to merge to me.
@mxm can you include this in the next rc? It's quite critical IMO.
Ping.

There are still two issues I noticed. Printing to standard out should be disabled during the dry-run phase. Just like in the OptimizerPlanEnvironment. The other one is ContextEnvironment. Do you think you could refactor your changes in ContextEnvironment into a separate DetachedEnvironment? We don't really need the context for the dry run. Thus, we have a better separation of concerns with an extra class for the detached execution.
Manually merged
Can you also merge this into the 0.10 branch, so the 0.10.1 release will get the fix?
Already done. :smiley:

I think the best solution (also for future features like the SQL API) is a TableConfig, where TimeZone, Locales, and also the `nullCheck` can be configured. Once #1237 is merged (hopefully soon), I will implement that into the `TableEnvironment`. What do you think?

@sachingoel0101 thank you for taking these tickets. This patch handles large counts quite nicely. The only negative I see is that the colored boxes are generally no longer aligned. How about adding something like `min-width: 3em` in both files to replace the original `width: 2em`?
That'll take up unnecessary space for labels with small values like, say, 3-4.
Merging this, together with https://github.com/apache/flink-web/pull/13 and https://github.com/apache/flink-web/pull/12
Any news here, @jaoki ?
Thanks @s1ck! It looks good :-) I'll merge later today.
+1 Although the Scala color scheme could be improved...

Hi @mxm , I'm not sure about directing sysout and syserr to null. Detached mode just means flink jobs are being run in detached mode; the rest of the program should go whatever way the user requested.

As for refactoring into a separate environment, I agree. I've already done that.

Thanks for the timely update @sachingoel0101. 

I was referring to the acquisition of the plan. When we create the plan, (e.g. ./bin/flink info JAR) we suppress printing to standard out. I thought we should do similar when we create the detached plan which we submit only after we have determined whether we can run the jar in detached mode. I ran some of the examples in detached mode and found it odd that it prints to stdout during the creation of the plan. The actual execution of the plan should of course be able to print to stdout. What do you think?

When the main method is invoked via `PackagedProgram#invokeInteractiveModeForExecution`, it executes everything, and the flink plan it builds is stored in the `DetachedEnvironment`[now]. 
I just ran an example with the new code, and it prints something like this on the cli:
![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8874261/11033786/2cfad902-870c-11e5-8605-8bca4782443f.PNG)
Is this what you mean? If not, can you check again?

I just realized we also need to make the optimizer aware that two auto-sampled range partitionings are not equivalent. These checks the to be added to the `areCompatible()` methods of the `AbstractJoinDescriptor` and `CoGroupDescriptor` to avoid incorrect joins and coGroups.

For now, it is sufficient to simply return `false` if a range partitioning is observed for a join or coGroup. Later, we want to add a property to the `GlobalProperties` that identifies the data distribution which is used for the range partitioning.
Yes, the idea is suppress output during the dry-run and plan creation.

Thanks a lot for working on this.
I've tried out your changes locally, and it was working as expected.
- Why is there a 10 MB limit on the upload? Usually people use the web interface in their LAN, so big files might be quite common.

This can be fixed, but it requires breaking the existing Netty pipeline. The `HttpObjectAggregator` requires a max content length, which I think cannot be set to too high; 10 MB seemed reasonable. [I tried setting it to 100 MB and the JVM ran out of heap space surprisingly. Does the web monitor also use heap space out of Job Manager? ]
I am not at all familiar with Netty however, and all I know is what I learnt while working on this. If anyone has an idea how to handle large uploads, in the existing pipeline, please let me know. :)
Otherwise I think replacing the `HttpObjectAggregator` with something that handles large payloads on disk might be a good idea. An example is here: https://github.com/netty/netty/blob/master/example/src/main/java/io/netty/example/http/upload/HttpUploadServerHandler.java
It should be able to handle everything cleanly.
Okay, I see. Lets not fix it as part of this pull request.
10MB isn't a lot for a fat jar which is how we advise our users to package their programs.

Mh, Fabian is right. In practice, jar files very often exceed 10 MB.

>  Does the web monitor also use heap space out of Job Manager? ]

Yes, the web monitor is running in the same JVM as the JM.
I also have no experience with netty, but it shouldn't be too hard to copy the files to disk without allocating the entire file on the heap first. Can you look into this?

Are you sure you tested the change with YARN?
I'm getting the following error: http://i.imgur.com/3WDAgfd.png

The change per se looks good. Jersey core and client have no big transitive dependencies they pull, so it should be fine.

+1 to merge

@rmetzger. Ah yes. Figured it out. You must be testing on the yarn rm proxy page I assume. Apparently, `POST` requests are not allowed through the proxy to AMs. I forgot to mention this in the description. If you know of a config entry to `yarn-site.xml` which can allow this, please let me know.

If you try the job manager web interface directly though, it should work.

Thanks for extending the documentation of the Table API. I added a few comments to the Java section. Most apply to the Scala section as well.

Thanks, Fabian
I just verified the fix on the Azure cluster with Hadoop 2.6.0 and it's working now.
Ping.
